snippet.title: 3D Printing Sombrero Merch
snippet.description:
I decided to print up some merch to hand out at gaming events for my indie game Sombrero. I'm printing on a Flashforge Creator Pro 3D printer that I picked up a few months back.

For those into 3D printing:
The original coin was created in Illustrator & 3DSMAX. I used Hatchbox PLA in metallic silver & gold filament, and printed slowly at 30/ms. The extruder was heated to 197C and the bed was heated to 60C. Printing slowly and at a lower temperature kept the fine details of the coins intact. Sequential printing was set up in Simplify3D. 

GET IN ON SOMBRERO TESTING: http://apply.pixelmetal.com

MORE BEHIND THE SCENES PHOTOS OF THE 3D PRINTING: http://site.pixelmetal.com/3d-printed-schwag-preview/

Music:
"A Belly Full of Spaghetti" from the Sombrero Soundtrack by Bubble Pipe Media: http://bubblepipemedia.com

Links:
Sombrero: http://pixelmetal.com
Twitter: http://twitter.com/PixelMetal
Facebook: http://facebook.com/PixelMetal
